Class GameBoard

java.lang.Object
  GameBoard

public class GameBoard
extends java.lang.Object

This class is the main engine of the monopoly game. It uses all the objects from our code and various data structures to run the game.

Version:
May 23, 2015
Author:
William Wang, Aditya Kotak, Rahul Sarathy., Period: 6, Assignment: MonopolyGame, Sources: none

Method Detail

startGUI

public void startGUI(Player p,
                     javax.swing.JTextArea text)

startGame

public void startGame()
This method starts the game and continues until there is only one player left. It will let the player buy until it runs out of money and will mortgage assets for the player if the player does not have enough money.

move

public ListNode2<Space> move(Player p,
                             int numOfSpaces)
This method moves the player on the gameboard.

Parameters:
p - the player who moves
numOfSpaces - the number of spaces to be moved
Returns:
the space that the player lands on

rollDie

public void rollDie(Player p,
                    javax.swing.JTextArea text)
This method rolls the dice for a player and moves the player accordingly. It will allow the player to do the action specified by that space. It also makes sure that if there are doubles the player can roll again. If there are three doubles, this player gets sent to jail.

Parameters:
p -
